title: What happens if you leave the ER before being seen? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depending on what you are there for and if you were just in the waiting room or actually in an ER room and had any treatment but at the minimum it’ll be documented that you left, any details of treatment you received while there. If you did receive any treatment or care then yeah you’ll still get a bill and I’m sure a phone call or two to check up on you (or should at least). If you are being evaluated for anything that could be potentially self harming, suicidal or danger to others than the police will be called and they will be following up that way. But if you we’re just in the waiting room a notation would be made when they called you to go back and you weren’t there, nothing more.

What happens if you leave the ER before being seen? Obviously, you won’t get seen. If you actually had a true emergency, you’ll likely come back—and soon—either to the original ER or another. Either that, or your next hours will be very unpleasant and then you won’t have to worry about it any more. If you didn’t have a true emergency, you just did yourself and the ER staff a favor. How very thoughtful of you.

I’m sure it happens more often than you think. Some people may not want to wait or think the wait time is unreasonable, it’s the patient’s choice. Even if you have received some treatment technically they cannot stop you from leaving. But that would be considered “against medical advice” or AMA. That would be noted in your chart for that visit.

You still owe money if they took information. Putting you into the system is a charge. I go to Urgent Care whenever possible. The ER is way too long of a wait. It seems like a waste of time unless you are really serious.
